title.value: Dependence of the crude protein content in the winter triticale grain on weather conditions and elements of cultivation technology
Зависимость содержания сырого протеина в зерне озимого тритикале от погодных условий и элементов технологии возделывания

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Bulavina, T.M., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming
Leonov, F.N., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented results into the study of the influence of winter triticale (Triticosecale) cultivation conditions on crude protein content in the grain of this crop. Content of crude protein in winter triticale grain is one of the main indicators of its quality and is more dependent on agro-ecological factors than the varietal characteristics of this culture. Optimization of nitrogen nutrition of plants rendered the most significant effect on the above mentioned index along with soil and weather conditions. In a much lesser degree the content of crude protein in the grain of the culture depends on the proceeding crop, the method of tillage, sowing, seeding rate, and the use of pesticides, trace elements and physiologically active substances. It is shown that factors differed by the importance of the influence on the above parameter can be arranged in the decreasing order: weather conditions in the period  of vegetation – optimization of nitrogen  nutrition  - soil cultivation level - variety - predecessor - tillage - application of pesticides, micro elements, and physiologically active substances.
